intro: Ludwigia glandulosa subsp. brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-seed Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The species typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several tiny seeds. This plant is often found in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments and is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels.
